comments:
build 205 on Win98.

This happened 3 times.

1). I was looking at Java code and selected something in the Outline view and 
Eclipse died without any warning. No log messages or dialogs.

2). I restarted, opened up the Java class again, clicked around in the Outline 
and it was ok. Then I clicked on a method in the outline, did a search, then 
double-clicked on the single search result and Eclipse died without warning 
again. Again without a log or dialog.

3). Restarted again. Pressed the Open to Type button, typed in the class name 
and hit ok. Eclipse died, got 3 dialogs saying that an error has occurred, and 
got the following in my log file.

From stack trace looks like exception originated in JavaErrorTickUpdater. 

Moving to JDT for comment.

It looks like doUpdateErrorTicks is missing an isDisposed test on the 
JavaEditor's control.

i'm trying to fix this in the 3rd attempt... Not sure if successful. What I'm 
doing is a workaround:
The main problem is no 'isDisposed' on IWorkbenchParts or IEditorParts. So I 
can not know when setTitleImage is a problem.
Shouldn't the property change listeners do the disposed test?

Move to eclipse.ui

Change the WorkbenchPart code to discard property listeners on dispose. 
However, before doing this change, I was not able to reproduce this problem. 
Can you provide steps to reproduce this problem...I'm interested why the editor 
workbook is holding onto an editor which was disposed and then updating its tab.

Changes going into build > 2002-01-28

I haven't seen this behaviour in builds > 205.
I have no reproducable steps for this problem.
